tn.text: Yahweh continues telling Moses what the people must do.

tn.ref: the seventh month, on the first day of the month
tn.text: "the 7th month, on the 1st day of the month." This refers to the seventh month of the Hebrew calendar. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: have a holy assembly to honor Yahweh
tn.text: "gather together to worship and honor Yahweh." The phrase "a holy assembly" means the people gather together to worship Yahweh. Worshiping Yahweh is a holy event.

tn.ref: It will be a day when you blow trumpets
tn.text: Here the word "you" refers to the people of Israel who here represent the priests. The priests blew the trumpet to begin a worship service or to gather the community together. AT: "It will be a day when the priests blow trumpets" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Yahweh continues telling Moses what the people must do.

This refers to the grain offerings that are required to accompany each of the animals when they are sacrificed. AT: "the grain offerings that are offered with them" or "the grain offerings that accompany them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_possession]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "which you have mixed with oil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

"Three tenths" means three parts out of ten equal parts. This can be written in modern measurements. AT:  "six liters" or "three tenths of an ephah (which is about six liters)" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])

The words "of an ephah" are missing and may be added. "Two tenths" means two parts out of ten equal parts. This can be written in modern measurements. AT:  "four and a half liters" or "two tenths of an ephah (which is about 4.5 liters)" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])

tenth** - "one-tenth" means one part out of ten equal parts. This can be written in modern measurements. AT:  "2 liters" or "a tenth of an ephah (which is about 2 liters)" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])
The word "atonement" can be expressed with the verb "atone." AT: "to atone" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: the seventh month ... the first of each month
tn.text: "the 7th month ... the 1st day of each month" The word "month" refer to those in the Hebrew calendar. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: of each month: the special burnt offering ... with it
tn.text: "of each month--the special burnt offering ... with it." This is the offering that is made on the first day of each month.

tn.ref: the regular burnt offering, its grain offering, and its drink offerings
tn.text: This refers to the offerings the priests were to give every day. The grain offering and drink offering were to be offered with the regular burnt offering. AT: "the regular burnt offering, with the grain offering and drink offerings that accompany it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_possession]])

tn.ref: you will obey what has been decreed
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "you will obey Yahweh's decree" or "you will obey what Yahweh had decreed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: an offering made by fire to Yahweh
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "an offering you burnt on the altar to Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Yahweh continues telling Moses what the people must do.

tn.ref: the tenth day of the seventh month
tn.text: "the 10th day of the 7th month" The word "month" refers to those in the Hebrew calendar. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: have a holy assembly to honor Yahweh
tn.text: "gather together to worship and honor Yahweh." The phrase "a holy assembly" means the people gather together to worship Yahweh. Worshiping Yahweh is a holy event.
This can be stated in active form. AT: "which you have mixed with oil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

"Three tenths" means three parts out of ten equal parts. This can be written in modern measurements. AT:  "six liters" or "three tenths of an ephah (which is about six liters)" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])

The words "of an ephah" are missing and may be added. "Two tenths" means two parts out of ten equal parts. This can be written in modern measurements. AT:  "four and a half liters" or "two tenths of an ephah (which is about 4.5 liters)" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])

"A tenth" means one part out of ten equal parts. This can be written in modern measurements. AT:  "2 liters" or "a tenth of an ephah (which is about 2 liters)" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])
The word "atonement" can be expressed with the verb "atone." AT: "that atones for you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: its grain offering, and their drink offerings
tn.text: The grain offering was to be offered with the burnt offering. The drink offerings were to be offered with both the sin offering and the burnt offering. AT: "along with the grain offering and the drink offerings that accompany them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_possession]])
Yahweh continues telling Moses what the people must do.

tn.ref: the fifteenth day of the seventh month
tn.text: "the 15th day of the 7th month." The word "month" refer to those in the Hebrew calendar. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: have a holy assembly to honor Yahweh
tn.text: "gather together to worship and honor Yahweh." The phrase "a holy assembly" means the people gather together to worship Yahweh. Worshiping Yahweh is a holy event.

tn.ref: you must keep the festival for him
tn.text: This is an idiom. Here the word "keep" means to observe or celebrate. The word "him" refers to Yahweh. AT: "you must observe the festival for Yahweh" or "you must celebrate the festival for Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This can be stated in active form. "you must burn it on the altar" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: thirteen young bulls, two rams, and fourteen male lambs
tn.text: "13 young bulls, 2 rams, and 14 male lambs" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "which you have mixed with oil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

"13 bulls ... 14 lambs" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

AT:  "four and a half liters" or "two tenths of an ephah (which is about 4.5 liters)" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_fraction]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])

tn.ref: its grain offering, and the drink offering with it
tn.text: The grain offering and drink offering accompany the regular burnt offering.

tn.ref: the second day of the assembly
tn.text: "the 2nd day of the festival." Here the word "assembly" refers to the Festival of Weeks. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: twelve young bulls, two rams, and fourteen male lambs
tn.text: "12 young bulls, 2 rams, and 14 male lambs" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "as Yahweh commanded" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.text: "the 3rd day of the festival." Here the word "assembly" refers to the Festival of Weeks. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

"gather together again to worship Yahweh." This is another assembly similar to the one on the first day of the festival.

"planned festivals." These are festivals that occurred at regularly scheduled times. The word "fixed" means "set" or "predetermined."
